title: social engineering
extract: Social engineering, in the context of information security, refers to psychological manipulation of people into performing actions or divulging confidential information. This differs from social engineering within the social sciences, which does not contain the divulging of confidential information. A type of confidence trick for the purpose of information gathering, fraud, or system access, it differs from a traditional "con" in that it is often one of many steps in a more complex fraud scheme.
extract_html: Social engineering, in the context of information security, refers to psychological manipulation of people into performing actions or divulging confidential information.
